name: Raichu

attacks.name: Gigashock
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and this attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If your opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokémon, do the damage to each of them.

flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.

strengths: Gigashock spreads damage to multiple benched Pokemon
90 HP is very good for Stage 1
Lightning type is effective against Water Pokemon
weaknesses: Fighting weakness against popular Haymaker Pokemon
30 damage to Active is very low for 4 energy
High energy cost for modest damage output
synergies: Gengar (Curse to finish off damaged bench Pokemon)
Gust of Wind (bring damaged bench Pokemon active)
counters: Aggressive decks that win before spread damage matters

competitiveHistory: This non-holo version of Raichu is functionally identical to the holo version (#14). Raichu was designed for spread damage but its inefficient attack cost limited competitive viability. The non-holo printing made it accessible for casual players.

rulings.ruling: If opponent has exactly 3 Benched Pokemon, you must choose all 3 for the 10 damage.
If opponent has fewer than 3 Benched Pokemon, deal 10 damage to each of them (you can't hit the same one multiple times).
If opponent has no Benched Pokemon, Gigashock still does 30 damage to the Active Pokemon.
Weakness and Resistance are not applied to the bench damage.
